data.title: Very disappointed with this hotel!!!
data.text: I am writing this review from the hotel because I am on my third room and I am completely unsatisfied. I am staying here because I needed to stay somewhere close to the GM Tech Center. Upon arriving at the hotel it took 20 minutes before I received my room card (not acceptable if you ask me). There was only one women at the counter and two guests in front of me, all the while she fielded 3 phone calls from outside guests before I was taken care of. She was very friendly and apologetic and I had plenty of time to kill so it was no big deal. I took the elevator up and low and behold they put me in the room directly across from the elevator. Ughh, I tried to make it work but I am staying here on business and need to be able to get a good nice rest. I went back down stairs to request a new room and had to wait another 10 minutes in line while she struggled to check everyone in (I really felt bad because the line was literally so long that it was out the hotel door). 2 guests in front of me and 4 behind me and people calling. This hotel really needs to staff the front better and give this poor woman some assistance. She kindly swapped my room away from the elevator, yay!!! Right? No, the second room was covered in hair, hair on 3 out of 4 pillows, hair all over the bed sheet, some trash was actually left on the table (it was clothes tags from marshals) that was never picked up. None of the toiletries were replenished either, no soap or shampoo. I called down and told her the issue, she sent someone up who gave me a new room key. Okay, on to the third room, I arrived and guess what? More hair!!!! 1 out of 4 pillows had a long stringy hair on it!!! Gross....I sucked it up and just tossed it on the ground. They actually called from the front inquiring about the new room. I felt obligated to be honest and I told her I found another hair on one of the pillows but it's fine I just tossed it on the ground. She was very apologetic again and said she could not lower my rate since I supposedly had the lowest eligible rate ($99for the night) bs if you ask me (mind you I never asked for a rate down either) and I was on the companies dime anyways. She did offer to send up a fruit plate which I have not tried yet and gave me an additional 2500 points on my IGH account. Whatever...I appreciate the thought but the inconvenience is simply not worth it. Offering me free breakfast would have been nice but that did not happen. Also, to add details about the third room, there was a red stain on the tub, piece of hair on the toilet seat, could hear neighboring doors slamming all night as guests arrive. On to the air conditioning unit/fan....I had it set to 72 degrees cool (not heat) (outside weather was only a high of 66 degrees) no problem, right? No...the unit fired up about every ten minutes to cool the room and it literally sounded like a diesel truck hitting the gas outside the hotel every time, not kidding. I wish I could upload a sound clip to show everyone.?I haven't slept this bad in some time. I will rate this hotel 1/5 stars. I will not be staying here again....ever.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Brandon061792,

Thank you for leaving a candid review about our hotel on TripAdvisor. We value each feedback as this will allow us identify the areas that may benefit from our additional attention. It is disheartening to know that your overall experience was not as pleasant as it should have been. This is not the customer service we endeavor to deliver our guests and for that, we are truly sorry. We would like to look into this further, thus we sent you a private message to help us get additional information regarding this event. 
 
Again, thank you for staying with us and we hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,

Christian C.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nicely done
data.text:
I've stayed in several other hotels in the area before when coming to town on business.  With this being my first time at this Holiday Inn I thought I knew what to expect: an average room, clean bed, minimal frills.  I was surprised. 

I was greeted warmly, my room was ready when promised, the breakfast choices were great, and I was treated as if I were the guest that mattered.  The night before I checked out I was called and asked how my stay had been.

Overall, a really good experience!  Next time I am in town, this is where I'll stay.

data.title: Facility and Service Excellent
data.text: From my check-in with Sarah at the front counter to the service we received in the restaurant/lounge from Jina, the experience at this Holiday Inn was superb!  The room was modern, very clean and spacious, at an affordable price.  The food in the restaurant was well prepared and reasonably priced.

data.title: Family Reunion
data.text: We recently had our family reunion in Detroit.  Holiday Inn and Suites was our host hotel.  The rooms were very comfortable and clean.  I only wished the bathroom was bigger and the sink was inside the bathroom.  We ate breakfast once.  The cost was too much and the food was not good.  We had to find somewhere else to eat the next two days.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  If I am in the area again, I would consider staying again.

data.title: Always a great stay
data.text:
This was my second stay at the Holiday Inn. This hotel is clean, and fresh.
The staff is always helpful and friendly. Seamless check in.
They have single Kureig coffee maker, soft towels, and comfy beds, lots of blankets and pillows. 
Defiantly will stay again when I'm in the area again.

data.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff!
data.text:
The hotel is a little older but it is obvious that it is very well taken care of with renovations and the staff's care.  The rooms were very clean and large, the staff goes out of their way to make sure you are comfortable.  I want to make sure to acknowledge both Cody and Gina, who were always helpful and both always had a smile on their face!  
They have a hotel shuttle that takes guests to local businesses and there is a lot of restaurants nearby.

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text: I've been coming hear for the last 12 weeks and this is a Great hotel all the staff are excellent!!!!!!!!!! Very friendly and hospitable!!!!!!!!! The rooms are clean and comfortable..... Jina  is the best bartender ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! T.T.A.

data.title: WOW!!!
data.text: What a fantastic place. I stay in a lot of hotels but this one has so far been the best. I got in like 11pm and they had drinks in the room and were so polite. This morning the sweet lady at the desk packed us breakfast because we had to leave so early. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I will definatly be back. Lots of bus parking.

data.title: Great hotel
data.text: My fiancé and I recently stayed here this past weekend. We were so impressed with everything considering we're 10mins away from the hotel. The rooms were clean. Beds soft. Jacuzzi was clean and felt amazing. We slept like babies. The breakfast was soooo delicious. They have a instant pancake maker which was so cool. The staff was very nice. CHeckout was a breeze. We will definitely come back!

data.title: A GOOD PLACE TO STAY
data.text: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Suites in Warren, Michigan. The hotel would be a great place to stay for a business type person. Being in the vicinity of GM and Chrysler lends to that as they are right there. For families visiting Detroit, this might be a bit too far out of downtown if those are where the attractions you are seeing are. Besides a small pool there really wouldn't be much to do for children. The room was clean, well appointed and had a comfortable bed. The TV service was true digital and I did not hear any noise from other rooms. The front desk staff as well were very polite and quick in their service. I certainly would recommend that if someone is looking for a good hotel in this area they would fine in booking this location.

data.title: Thank you
data.text: Really nice hotel not that far away from downtown Detroit. The lobby was beautiful and the staff more than helpful. I loved our room I thought it was just what we paid for! I felt really safe in the area and they had a nice pool! A little crowded but that's how you know it's a good place to stop! Def would stay again

data.title: Nice hotel compared to others
data.text: The hotel was neat and clean.  The room was nice and as described. We left another hotel to come here since the other one was horrible.   The parking was adequate and located near the major tech center.  The safety seemed very good as well.  The food in the free dinner was not good.  But, I don't hold it against them.  The breakfast was moderately good.  Price was average on all accounts.  I rate this fairly high and recommend a stay here.

data.title: Workday Holiday Inn
data.text: The hotel is located in a pretty quiet area, I have to give the independent owner a lot of credit because they have done the mandatory upgrades that HGI requires. Rooms have crisp linen beds, bathrooms and entry are new, even down to the lamps and wallpaper. If you like HGI hotels, this is a great option that will not let you down.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Alinkal,

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your thoughts and comments regarding your stay with us. There is no greater satisfaction as a customer service professional than receiving kind words from a valued guest like you. We are delighted to know that you found our hotel to be nice and our location to be quiet. Reviews like yours motivate us to work harder to continuously provide the best guest experience possible.

Thank you for choosing our hotel and we look forward to accommodating your again in the future.

Best Regards,

Joel A
Case Manager
IHGCare
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great welcome and comfort
data.text: I spent two nights in great comfort last week. Staff very welcoming, felt like home. Angie found out my company and gave me complimentary breakfast I did not know to have. Pillows and bed very soft, good to relax after 12 hour travel.

data.title: Not bad for the area...
data.text: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  Free full breakfast and super friendly staff made the week delightful! Will definitely stay here again for work. The only negatives were the tv remote was hard to use and the shower was difficult to operate.

data.title: In town for Loverboy concert
data.text: We were part of a group of four couples staying the night. Angie was working the desk and you couldn't ask for a nicer, more welcoming employee. Our one night stay was excellent. I recommend anyone staying in the area to stay at this hotel. The breakfast buffet was typical of this type of a stay and was good.

owner_response.author: Neran M, Director of Sales at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for being our guest!

We greatly appreciate your wonderful comments about the hotel and it's amenities.

We are delighted you enjoyed your stay with us, and really appreciate you taking the time to post feedback. We will be certain to share your comments with Angie.

Thanks again for being our guest! 

Neran.M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: GREAT HOTEL!
data.text: The hotel looks great after the renovations... The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious. There is a restaurant/bar if you don't want to leave the property. The hotel is central to Shopping and great restaurants.  Will definitely stay at this property again in the near future.

owner_response.author: Neran M, Director of Sales at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for being our guest and posting this great review!

We are glad you enjoyed our newly remolded facility, we are vey excited about it's completion as well!

We appreciate your wonderful comments and hope to have the opportunity to serve you again!

Neran.M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Good Option in Warren/Sterling Heights
data.text:
I haven't stayed in a Holiday Inn for decades.  But, last week, on a quick business trip to Sterling Heights, the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren seemed like the best option.  

The proporty is on Van Dyke, right across from the GM Tech Center.  The area is bit depressed looking.  It seems like there aging parking lots around the hotel, than fuctioning businesses.  However, with GM investing a $1B in the tech center, I'd bet that's going to change soon. 

The hotel proved to be just fine for my needs.  The lobby area could use a little updating, but my room was clean, bright, and comfortable.  The wifi was free and functioned well.  I also liked that they have a free "Customer Appreciation Dinner" Monday through Wednesday. It was nothing fancy, but worked out well for me.  Finally, the free breakfast was actually pretty good.  It included a prepared meal AND a simple buffet.  

If you're looking for basic, no-frills accomodation in the Warren/Sterling Heights area, then this hotel will work for you.

owner_response.author: Neran M, Director of Sales at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for  your review.

We greatly appreciate all your wonderful comments about our facility. We apologize for the noise you incurred during the construction.    

I am pleased to report the renovations are complete and our lobby area is brand new . We are very excited to showcase it on your next visit with us.

Thank you for being our guest!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Being renovated
data.text:
We stayed here for one night after visiting the Zoo in Detroit. Its a little tricky to find as it doesn't sit right on Van Dyke but behind another building.

When we pulled up, there were workers landscaping the outside and there were more workers inside. From what we could see, this renovation was going to make this a great looking place.

Inside, they had our reservations, but since we were a little early we had to wait about 10 minutes. When we went up to our rooms, they were very nice, clean and the beds were comfortable.

Next morning, the breakfast was included. It was a little sparse, but included waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage and cereal with the usual bagels, juice and coffee.

This hotel was very nice and worth a stop.

owner_response.author: Neran M, Director of Sales at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your wonderful review of our facility.

We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and found the experience to be pleasing.

I want to repot that our renovation is now complete,  and we are very excited to showcase it.

It's great to know that you too advantage of the many amenities offered, as we encourage our guests to do just that.

Thank for being our guest!

Neran.M
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very displeased
data.text: My husband brought me with him to have his business meeting at Michigan so we booked for this hotel for 2 nights supposedly. We arrived at night after a long drive and just slept early. My husband went to have his meeting in the morning as I stayed at the hotel. Around 10am as I'm about to go use the bathroom I saw a cockroach looking bug I'm not sure what to call it but it looks like a cockroach at the floor. I took pictureS of it and sent one of the pics to my husband I said I don't want to spend another night there. After my husband's meeting he went back to the hotel and complain about it showed the picture to the front desk staff and they just not charge us for our stay and gave us 5,000 points to his ihg membership. We left the room and they stopped us at the lobby to tell us that the picture is not taken from their hotel. My husband was so upset and gave them the napkin with the roach on it. And I offered to show them more pictures since they are insinuating that we're lying. This is holiday inn not a cheap motel. I have the pictures and they could see the time the picture was taken and where it was taken don't make us look like liars. We travel so much and stay in alot of hotels. We don't need refunds. the company my husband works for pays for it, we don't have to lie and bring roach. I just hope your roach did not hop in our luggage. Not staying again and definitely won't recommend.

owner_response.author: Neran M, Director of Sales at Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Warren, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for being our guest !

We sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations.

When your husband provided the photo to our desk associate of the Incest you claimed to have found in in your room, the photo we saw was clearly not a photo taken at our property, we apologize for your confusion in in this. 

In fact, the room you had been in was just completely renovated and nothing in the photo you provided us shows any similarity to one of our rooms. In good faith , the desk associate offered your husband membership points as well as a free night prior to him texting our associate the  photo that undoubtedly was not taken at our facility!

Feel free to contact me directly @ 586-573-7600,  so that we could further discuss this confusion you had at our facility!

Thank you for being our guest!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
